title: Congratulating Mr. and Mrs. Angelo Simone upon the occasion of celebrating their 70th Wedding Anniversary
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  congratulating  Mr. and Mrs. Angelo Simone upon
the occasion of celebrating their 70th Wedding Anniversary

WHEREAS, Angelo Simone and Lucy Spiridilozzi were united in marriage  on
January 25, 1941, at Saint Anthony of Padua Church, Utica, New York; the
ceremony was officiated by Father Moaraity; and
  WHEREAS,  To celebrate this auspicious event, a brunch will be held in
their honor at the Radison, Utica, New York, on January 23, 2011, hosted
by their devoted children, with many friends and family  in  attendance;
and
  WHEREAS,  Mr.  and Mrs. Angelo Simone, affectionately known as Ang and
Lu, have led what some might consider a simple  life;  they  have  never
needed  to  travel  very far from home to know what was happening in the
world; they embody the fundamental values of hard work,  dedication  and
faith; and
  WHEREAS,   A  World  War  II  veteran,  Angelo  Simone  is  a  retired
foreman/machinist with Kelsey Hayes in Whitesboro, New York, after  many
years of distinguished service in the workforce; and
  WHEREAS,  In his retirement, Angelo finds joy working in his legendary
vegetable garden, reading NATIONAL GEOGRAPHIC, shopping,  serving  as  a
Eucharistic  Minister  at  Saint  Anthony  of  Padua Church or restoring
furniture in his self-composed workshop; he also enjoys traveling around
his town, being out in the community and talking to people; and
  WHEREAS, Lucy Simone can be  found  crocheting,  cooking,  baking  her
famous cookies, tending to her gorgeous flower garden or cheering on her
favorite  team, the New York Yankees; she also enjoys spending time with
her many family members and friends and takes great pride  in  her  home
where  the  door is always open and visitors are treated like royalty no
matter the time or day; and
  WHEREAS, They are the proud parents of five  beautiful  daughters  and
their husbands, Annette and Frank Sica, Kathleen and John Russo, Marlene
and  Robert  Conway,  Helen  Ann  and the late James Taurisano, and Mary
Therese and Joseph Jerzak, and the loving grandparents of 64  grandchil-
dren  and  great-grandchildren;  they  have a special way of making each
member of their family feel appreciated, supported and loved; and
  WHEREAS, Mr. and Mrs. Angelo Simone are and always have been  a  tower
of  strength, support, understanding and limitless love for their family
setting an extraordinary example for their children, of what it takes to
build a wonderful marriage and make a house a home; and
  WHEREAS, Mr. and Mrs. Angelo Simone have touched the  lives  of  their
family  and  many friends through the shining example of their marriage,
which is a testament to the devotion and admiration which  they  possess
for one another; and
  WHEREAS,  Their love, devotion, caring, sensitivity and responsiveness
to their family, friends and all who know them are  their  hallmark  and
tradition; and
  WHEREAS,  Mr.  and  Mrs. Angelo Simone have lived and continue to live
their lives with great dignity and genuine grace, always demonstrating a
deep and continuing concern for human  values  and  ideals,  and  in  so
doing, they have inspired others to do the same; and
  WHEREAS, This meaningful occasion is the result of the love, hard work
and spirit this couple has invested in their marriage; and
  WHEREAS,  The  longevity of this enduring marriage truly marks a mile-
stone in life's journey, an event of personal triumph and joy; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that when  an  occa-
sion  of such importance is brought to our attention, the same should be

memorialized by us for the edification and  emulation  of  others;  now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
congratulate Mr. and Mrs. Angelo Simone upon the occasion of celebrating
their 70th Wedding Anniversary; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Mr. and Mrs. Angelo Simone.
